title: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in Java editor
description:
When performing a revert operation in the Java editor, it takes significantly longer compared to closing and reopening the file. The issue occurs when performing the following steps:

1. Answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog
2. Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it

Observed Behavior (OB): However, if I repeat steps 1 and 2, and then select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.

Expected Behavior (EB): The 'Revert' operation should be performed in a similar timeframe as the close and reopen method.

Steps to Reproduce (SR):

1. Open a Java file in the editor
2. Make changes to the file without saving
3. Answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog
4. Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it
5. Right click on the editor window
6. Select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu
7. Observe the time taken to replace the contents of the window with the original
